sentences.english: I've done this for many years and it works like a charm, " said the director.
sentences.chinese: 這就像個魔咒一樣，我這麼些年屢試不爽。

sentences.english: Even in my sleep-deprived state I've managed to pull off one of my classic pranks.
sentences.chinese: 即使處於睡眠不足狀態，我的惡作劇還是屢試不爽。

sentences.english: But it has been on the money in the past three years.
sentences.chinese: 不過，在過去的三年中卻是屢試不爽。

definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to force someone to do something
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
